Trigger.Name: 2 Sigma "/e _test sigma"
Trigger.Description: 1 cross 2 triangle 3 chain1 4 attack1 5 attack2 6 ignore1 7 ignore2 8 chain2

Trigger.Name: 3 Omega "/e _test omega" (will go through both patterns, takes about 50 seconds to complete!)
Trigger.Description:
marks (first set) 1 - attack2 2 - bind1 3 - attack1 4 - ignore1 5 - triangle 6 - plus 7 - ignore2 8 - bind2
marks (second set) 1 - bind1 2 - attack2 3 - triangle 4 - ignore1 5 - ignore2 6 - attack1 7 - bind2 8 - plus

Trigger.Name: ##INSTRUCTIONS - see description tab
Trigger.Description:
INFO Hi! Thanks for using my AM. I don't recommend the beta version of Trig with this, loops are a bit wonky in it, especially with mutexes. My testing is done on 1.1.7.1. If you have any issues with the markers, make sure to read the instructions and information below. In the case that the instructions don't solve your issue or answer your question, head to the P5 Automarkers thread in the Triggernometry discord and let me know what's going on. Please do not DM me without asking. If you can provide Trig logs, that would be best; make sure to grab them before you close ACT as they cannot be retrieved afterward. If you search for "Dynamis" before copying the log, that should filter out any other triggers you're using. Happy progging! - Sable
TELESTO Telesto is *required* for these triggers, to build the party list and to send the mark commands to the game. Telesto will automatically pull the party list order at the end of p4, so do not change your party list order between p4 and p6. You can also use "/e _reset" to manually trigger telesto to rebuild the party list. https://github.com/paissaheavyindustries/Telesto
MARKERS TRIANGLE - Near World PLUS - Far World Attack1&2 - Mechanic (fists, monitors, tethers) Ignore1&2 - Far Bait Bind1&2 - Near Bait Markers will self clear once the Near/Far World debuffs resolve, or upon party wipe. To change these you have to copy the entire repo to your local triggers and modify the Mark Players trigger yourself.
CHEATSHEETS Sigma - attack1&2 and ignore1 always go to the female, everyone else go across from the female. All players follow the rotating line to get to their spots (if it's CCW, positions are flipped E/W so ignore1 is always opposite Far World) https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SableCentaur/ffxiv/master/Triggernometry/XMLs/TOP%20Dynamis%20AM%20Cheatsheets/sigma-1.png https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SableCentaur/ffxiv/master/Triggernometry/XMLs/TOP%20Dynamis%20AM%20Cheatsheets/sigma-2alt.png
Omega - treat the monitor side and beetle as north, and you can resolve both of these in the same manner, just be careful to not get clipped by the monitor. https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SableCentaur/ffxiv/master/Triggernometry/XMLs/TOP%20Dynamis%20AM%20Cheatsheets/omega-1.png https://raw.githubusercontent.com/SableCentaur/ffxiv/master/Triggernometry/XMLs/TOP%20Dynamis%20AM%20Cheatsheets/omega-2.png
For both Trios, Near/Far World should stand on the 4th line in from the edge of the arena to ensure the outside ring is safe for baits, and prevent near/far world from being too close together. Mechanic players should always stand relative north of the intercardinal to prevent clipping people with mechanics.
TEST TRIGGERS To test, you can go into an instance of with a party of 8. Use the "/e _reset" command to force telesto to update the party list before you test. Then, use one of the following commands in game: /e _test delta /e _test sigma /e _test omega Please note that the test triggers will take a few seconds to mark. The omega trigger also simulates both parts of the mechanic (monitors and tethers), so it will take another 35 seconds to mark the second set. The markers will self clear once the simulation is complete (which is when the near/far world debuffs would resolve for each trio), but if you fire another test trigger before it completes, it will interrupt them and clear the marks so they should not interfere with each other. The test triggers are preset scenarios which means you'll get the same variation every time, so sorry you can't effectively use them to practice. *****If you add marker delays in the Priority configuration trigger, the test triggers will also be affected****
CUSTOMIZATION If you only want auto markers for a specific trio, disable the trigger(s) labeled with the one(s) you do not want. Priority -- If you wish to customize the priority or add delay to Sigma/Omega markers, copy the folder labeled "copy to local" to your local triggers. Make sure the local copy is enabled, and the remote copy of the folder is disabled. If you are happy with the default prio, you can enable it in remote without copying it.
Once you've copied the Priority trigger, open it and change the order that party members are pushed to the priority list by changing the order of the actions. The order of players in the Priority list will dictate which players will be assigned mechanics first, if possible. Suggested priority: THDDDDHT Players closer to the top of the list will have higher priority to be assigned mechanic positions in if they meet dynamis requirements (Sigma fists & Omega monitor baits, assuming 2nd in line near/far world does not have 2 dynamis). The two players at the top of the list will never get near baits, and the two players at the end of the list will never get far baits. Once Near/Far World and Mechanic players are eliminated from the priority list, bait assignments for the remaining 4 players are done in the following order: Far 1, Far 2, Near 2, Near 1 This is to ensure that the first and last players in the list will always get the first baits if they have to do one, so you can put the tanks at the top and bottom of the priority list to ensure they will never be assigned a second bait and potentially die to an auto under magic vuln after Sigma. Alternatively you can force tanks to always get a dynamis stack in Delta, and put them both at the top of the priority list so that if they do not get Near/Far world, they will be assigned the fist baits and never do Near/Far baits at all in Sigma. Delay -- If a delay on the markers is desired for Sigma and Omega part 1 to prevent visual clutter during playstation and M/F+Wave Cannons, enable the delay actions in the local Priority trigger. The suggested/default values are 26 for sigma (markers will appear during towers knockback) and 17 for omega (markers will appear during the second aoe dodge), but you can edit them if you would like longer/shorter delays. *****Added delays will impact the test triggers too, so you'll have to remember to be patient if you use the test triggers*****

TOP Dynamis Automarker Sigma FAR: ${var:TOPdynamisAMfar}, NEAR: ${var:TOPdynamisAMnear}, MECH1: ${var:TOPdynamisAM.mech0}, MECH2: ${var:TOPdynamisAM.mech1}

TOP Dynamis Automarker Omega 2 FAR: ${var:TOPdynamisAMfar}, NEAR: ${var:TOPdynamisAMnear}, MECH1: ${var:TOPdynamisAM.mech0}, MECH2: ${var:TOPdynamisAM.mech1}
